intro: Gamocarpha ligulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Gamocarpha ligulata is often found in the western United States and is adapted to arid environments.
